abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Tourism Development Project
            for Jordan had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: The complexity of the local
            environment at project appraisal, arose from a combination
            of mostly competing interests. Accurately gauging the
            capacity of key participating agencies and their commitment
            to core project objectives both prior to and during project
            implementation. Establishing a clear consensus with the
            counterpart agency on the need for and relevance of
            strategic planning and programming, and ensuring that the
            agency has the will and capacity to undertake the task effectively.

5083166.trustfund: TF029404-PHRD: TOURISM II/URBAN UPGRADING/,TF025182-PHRD-TOURISM II (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED),TF025287-PHRD-TOURISM II (BANK-EXECUTED),TF034014-JORDAN - SECOND TOURISM DEVELOPMENT
5083166.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Social dev/gender/inclusion

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of
            Jordan's Second Tourism Development Project are to: a)
            create the conditions for an increase in sustainable and
            environmentally sound tourism in Petra, Wadi Run. Jerash and
            Karak; and b) to realize tourism related employment and
            income generation potential at project sites. The project
            consists of four components. The first, Petra Region
            infrastructure development and environmental management,
            will consist of road rehabilitation, urban infrastructure
            development, site enhancement, visitor management,
            environmental protection and management, and Petra Region
            Planning Council Capacity building. The Second Component,
            Wadi Run development and environmental conservation, will
            consist of: infrastructure development; protected area
            conservation and management; visitor management services;
            and local community, especially Bedouin women, income
            generating activities. The Karak and Jerash Tourism
            Development Pilot Program containing feasibility studies and
            implementation is the third component; while sector
            development support, including technical assistance to the
            Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities and project management
            services, is the fourth.
